greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least k such that the remainder when 8^k is divided by k is n.
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 with -1 for those entries where a(n) has not yet been found
mathematica: Do[k = 1; While[PowerMod[8, k, k] != n, k++ ]; Print[k], {n, 48}]
results.author: _Ryan Propper_, Jun 12 2006
ext: a(49) <= 1885511821439 from Joe K. Crump (joecr(AT)carolina.rr.com), Feb 10 2007
I extended the Mathematica coding to reflect the new search limits as posted in the b text file _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 17 2009
Value of a(49) as conjectured by J. K. Crump verified by _Hagen von Eitzen_, Jul 24 2009
